content_parts.title: Export journal entries in FEC format

content_parts.content: From the Journal entry inquiry page, you can export journal entries to Excel or to a CSV format. The exported file is based on the French FEC (Fichier des Écritures Comptables) audit file format. It includes essential data such as general ledger accounts, posting dates, amounts, tax codes and so on. The file provides a comprehensive overview of financial activities for auditing purposes or for importing into your accounting system.

content_parts.content:
On the Purchase order page, when a purchase order line links to a sales order line, the Assigned to column displays an icon.

In the Assigned orders window, you can review order details, change the assigned quantity and access the sales order line.

You can manage the stock cost of an item using the First In First Out (FIFO) valuation method. When you select this method on the Item-site page, the FIFO valuation method creates unique cost tiers as items are received into stock.  The tiers are then consumed in chronological order as the stock is sold or issued. 

The FIFO cost stack inquiry displays the active cost tiers with the original quantity, quantity remaining and the associated costs.

content_parts.title: Stock allocations: Stock count and Stock detailed inquiry

content_parts.content:
To post a Stock count, the counted quantity of a stock item needs to be greater than or equal to the allocated quantity of the item otherwise an error is displayed, and the count posting is blocked.

You can view stock allocations for an item on the Stock detailed inquiry page. From the More actions icon for an inspection status or lot, select Allocations. The individual document numbers and quantity of stock allocated to each document is displayed.

content_parts.content:
When working with a purchase order, the step flow at the top of the page provides an instant view of where the document is in the process.

With quick entry functionality, you can add lines directly in the grid and add to the document by selecting Ctrl + Enter on your MS computer or command + Enter on a Mac.

In the Line panel, you can add multiple lines and scroll through all lines in the document.

In the column panel, you can select which columns you want to display or hide such as Item description and Price origin. Required columns display by default and cannot be hidden.

With quick entry functionality, you can add lines directly in the grid and add to the document by selecting Ctrl + Enter on your MS computer or command + Enter on a Mac.

In the Line panel, you can add multiple lines and scroll through all lines in the document.

In the column panel, you can select which columns you want to display or hide such as Item description and Price origin. Required columns display by default and cannot be hidden.
For purchasing and sales documents, the Main list displays All open statuses by default. You can filter the list by the document status such as Approved, Draft, Partially received and so on.
For purchasing and sales documents, Set default dimensions was moved to the More actions menu at the top of the page.

When creating or modifying a purchasing or sales document, the Cancel and Save buttons display at the bottom of the page.

When you modify a document, these buttons are replaced with the next logical step in the workflow, such as Submit for approval or Reject and Approve. The buttons that display depend on the document status.
